newsitem.title: ISRAEL: B.V.R. gets $14.5 mln European contract.
newsitem.headline: B.V.R. gets $14.5 mln European contract.

text.p: Israel's B.V.R. Technologies Ltd announced on Sunday it has entered into a contract with a European member of NATO for the supply of a full-scale simulator for F-16 aircraft.
The contract is worth $14.5 million and delivery of the system is expected in 1998.
The simulator will train pilots in diversified missions including emergency situations.
B.V.R. competed for the contract in an open tender against leading companies from the United States and France.

As reported, in the first quarter the company was awarded a $40 million contract for the supply of a simulator to a Southeast Asian country. As a result of these two contracts, the backlog of B.V.R.'s simulators division increased by about $55 million.
